A1.name: Precision Adder
A1.Z: offset = ±10V in 1V steps derived from Z
A1.A: A = X + Y + offset, or X + offset
A1.B: B = X – Y – offset, or Y ± offset

A2.name: Four Quadrant Multiplier
A2.Z: scale = 1/10 to 10x in steps derived from Z

parameters.name: Z Mode (when 1, the scale is not restricted to integer steps, and changes smoothly with Z).

A3.name: Full-wave Rectifier
A3.A: A = abs( X + Y ) or abs( X )
A3.B: B = abs( X - Y ) or abs( Y )

A5.name: Linear/Exponential Converter
A5.Z: Z is Hz/V scale, centred on 1kHz

A6.name: Quantizer
A6.Z: Z chooses scale & function of Y
A6.Y: Y = transpose (Z positive) or trigger (Z negative)

B2.name: Slew Rate Limiter
B2.A: A = linear slew rate limited ( X + Y )
B2.B: B = log slew rate limited ( X + Y )

B3.name: Pitch and Envelope Tracker
B3.Z: Z is slew rate for envelope
B3.A: A = V/octave pitch derived from X, plus Y

parameters.name: Sets an attenuation for output A.
Sets an attenuation for output B.
Sets an offset for output A.
Sets an offset for output B.

B7.name: VCO with linear FM
B7.A: A & B are selectable output waveforms

parameters.name: Sets an attenuation for output A.
Sets an attenuation for output B.

B8.name: VCO with waveshaping
B8.Z: Z is tune ±0.5 octaves or sync
B8.A: A & B are selectable output waveforms

parameters.name: Sets an attenuation for output A.
Sets an attenuation for output B.
Offset for input Y (manual shape control).

C1.name: Precision Adder (fractional offsets)
C1.Z: offset in steps derived from Z

C2.name: Voltage Controlled Delay Line
C2.B: B is delay output plus input signal

parameters.name: Applies an offset to the Y input.

C3.name: Clockable Ping Pong Delay (Z feedback)
C3.X: X is audio input Y is clock

C4.name: Clockable Ping Pong Delay (Z input pan)
C4.X: X is audio input Y is clock

C5.name: Resonator
C5.Y: Y is centre frequency (pitch) Z is gain
C5.B: B is envelope of audio output

parameters.name: Applies an offset to the Y input.

C7.name: Phaser
C7.A: A is phase-shifted output plus input signal

parameters.name: Applies an offset to the Y input.
Sets the number of phaser stages.

C8.name: Bit Crusher
C8.Y: Y is sample rate input Z sets bit reduction

parameters.name: Applies an offset to the Y input.

D1.name: DJ Filter
D1.X: X & Y are stereo audio input
D1.A: A & B are stereo audio output

D5.name: LP/HP Filter
D5.A: A is low pass filter output B is high pass filter output

D6.name: LP/BP Filter
D6.A: A is low pass filter output
D6.B: B is band pass filter output

D7.name: BP/HP Filter
D7.A: A is band pass filter output
D7.B: B is high pass filter output

D8.name: BP/Notch Filter
D8.A: A is band pass filter output

E3.name: Dual AR Envelope
E3.Z: Z sets the envelope times A is envelope output A

G3.name: Pitch Reference
G3.Z: Z sets the amplitude of A & B

G4.name: Frequency Reference
G4.Z: Z sets the amplitude of A & B

G5.name: Tuner
G5.Z: Z sets the amplitude of B
G5.A: A is a copy of X
G5.B: B is a sine wave at the tracked pitch

G8.name: CV/MIDI
G8.Z: Z is mod wheel or velocity CV input
G8.A: A & B pass through X & Y

H1.name: Crossfade/Pan
H1.A: A = Mix of X & Y according to Z
H1.B: B = Inverted mix of X & Y according to Z, or LFO

H6.name: Dual Delayed Pulse Generator
H6.Z: Z function depends on parameter setting
H6.A: A is pulse triggered by X
H6.B: B is pulse triggered by Y

H7.name: Noise
H7.A: A is noise, optionally scaled by X
H7.B: B is noise, optionally scaled by Y

H8.name: Quantizer 2
H8.Z: Z sets the interval between A & B
H8.Y: Y is trigger input or pitch CV input

I2.name: Clocked Audio Playback
I2.Z: Z selects the sample, or start position

parameters.name: Selects the sample and function of Z.

I8.name: Dual Audio Playback with Z Speed

parameters.name: Select which sample(s) are affected by Z.

J4.name: Audio Playback with End CV
J4.Z: Z is end position or retrigger CV
J4.X: X is retrigger or end position CV

K1.name: Wavetable VCO
K1.B: B is sub-octave square output or detuned output

K7.name: Stereo Clockable SD Delay
K7.X: X & Y are stereo audio inputs
K7.A: A & B are stereo audio outputs

K8.name: Stereo Clockable SD Delay (Z clock)
K8.X: X & Y are stereo audio inputs
K8.A: A & B are stereo audio outputs

L3.name: Dual Reverb
L3.X: X and Y are audio inputs

L7.name: Mixer
L7.Z: Z is pan for input X

M1.name: Delayed LFO
M1.A: A and B are LFOs, ramps, or ramped LFOs

M2.name: Scaled LFO
M2.X: X and Y are min/max or offset/scale

M3.name: Logic
M3.Z: Z selects logical operation for output
M3.A: A and B are logic outputs

N1.name: Switch
N1.Z: Z is control CV or trigger

N2.name: Rotary
N2.A: A and B are stereo outputs

N8.name: Clockable SD Ping Pong
N8.A: A & B are stereo audio outputs
